intro: Delphinium divaricatum, commonly known as the variable larkspur, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It features tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach heights of up to 2 meters, adorned with clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant has palmately divided leaves, which are typically lobed and hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its striking flowers and ecological importance, it is a valued plant in both horticulture and wildflower gardens.
